monday.talkName: Job market in Brazil, abroad and in the world OpenSource
monday.subtitle: Rodrigo Nascimento & Rafael Kellermann Streit
monday.talkDescription: A chat about the job market in Brazil and abroad, about remote jobs and its challenges, a dab on entrepreneurship and how it all works in the Open Source world.

tuesday.subtitle: Ari Stopassola Junior
tuesday.talkDescription: PHP renaissance (evolution since version 5.3), new features (Traits, Generators, Closures, OPCache, built-in server), PHP-FIG and PSR standards, components (Composer), frameworks, best practices, hosting, provisioning, optimization , continuous integration, deployment, testing (PHPUnit, Behat and Codeception), profiling (debug), queue mechanisms, ORM (Object-Relational Mapping), HHVM, Hack and PHP7, PHP ecosystem, extensions and community.

wednesday.talkName: The fall of the Berlin Wall
wednesday.subtitle: Gabriel Viégas & Roberto Fermann
wednesday.talkDescription: Bringing down barriers to develop (good) products.

wednesday.subtitle: Robson Júnior
wednesday.talkDescription:
Show the importance of JavaScript and why it is so powerful. I will address the evolution of language and things that can be done with it, such as:
  • Set (a simple game of old, running in Client-Side)
  • Augmented Reality
  • Back-End
  • Database
  • A small little game Hack (XSS - Reflected / Storage)
